New Records: Rachin Ravindra claimed his first half-century in the format with 68 runs off 35 balls.
Key Match Events: Tim David hit a four off the last ball to give Australia a six-wicket victory.
Rachin Ravindra hit 68 runs off 35 balls.
Mitchell Marsh finished with best bowling figures of 1-21.
Travis Head was caught by Tim Southee off the bowling of Adam Milne for 24.
David Warner was caught by Glenn Phillips for 32.
Glenn Maxwell was clean-bowled by Lockie Ferguson for 25.
Josh Inglis was dismissed with three overs left, making 20.
Adam Milne was smashed for 19 runs in the penultimate over.
Australia needed 15 from the last six balls, and Tim David held his nerve by smashing a six before sending the final ball to the boundary.
Pre-Game Insights: The three-match series is the last for both teams before the T20 World Cup in the United States and West Indies in June.
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell Marsh admitted he thought they were done but praised Tim David's calmness and confidence.
New Zealand captain Mitchell Santner commented on Australia's batting power and the need to take wickets to stop them.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series moves to Auckland with the next two T20 internationals both to be played at Eden Park, on Friday and Sunday, before a two-Test series.
